intro: Cleistanthus elongatus, commonly known as the longpod cleistanthus, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and distinctive yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces elongated, woody capsules that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
